instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
threads.message:
Arrived with fans running fast. No liquid damage. Tried replacement heatsink, good known trackpad and trackpad cable but no changes.

Apple diagnostic says problem might be with the SMC and HW monitor says heatpipe #2 is 128C

What should be tried next???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
threads.message: Also noticed both heatsinks never feel hot to the touch

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
threads.message:
Try known good trackpad flex/board.
Inspect <TRANSISTOR>Q5803</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U5860</CHIP> areas.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
threads.message:
This board is pristine looking with no liquid damage all around.

Using a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boardview. <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is still not available correct?

What should be checked or measured next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
threads.message:
00163 boardview may help also.

Try disconnecting RIO flex (J9510).
Check continuity from <CHIP>U5860</CHIP>/70 to their corresponding temp sensors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
threads.message:
<CHIP>U5870</CHIP> continuity is good. <CHIP>U5860</CHIP> does not exist in boardview

disconnecting RIO flex had no change.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
threads.message:
Unfortunatelly, the boardview is not for this model.
However, <CHIP>U5860</CHIP> has an internal sensor and should be placed close to left fin stack, on top side (SMC side); as per schematic mention.
Search for <TRANSISTOR>Q5803</TRANSISTOR> near the right fin stack.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
threads.message:
Found <CHIP>U5860</CHIP> top left side of board (SMC side)

Replaced but still no change. Also checked all surrounding resistors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
threads.message:
"Search for <TRANSISTOR>Q5803</TRANSISTOR> near the right fin stack."
Good traces???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
threads.message: HWMonitor shows only one temp error?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
threads.message: just heatpipeoutgoing air and airport proximity

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
threads.message: Correct boardview should be available in XinZhiZao.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
threads.message:
Airport temperature is sensed by <CHIP>U5823</CHIP>.
Inspect for corrosion, resolder it and check <RESISTOR>R5822</RESISTOR>.
If still the same, remove it and test the machine again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fans
threads.message: Solved. Still fast fan when <CHIP>U5823</CHIP> was removed but back to normal speed once <CHIP>U5823</CHIP> replaced
